results.title: Camels and the Pitjantjara
results.creator_credit: Roger Sandall, Curtis Levy and Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies
results.brief_description: Shows the daily life of nomadic Central Australians of the Pitjantjara tribe who have acquired camels, guns and other modern equipment. Shows the capture of a wild camel and travels in the MacDonnell Range; hunting rabbits and living off the land.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roger Sandall, Curtis Levy and Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies

results.title: Camberwick Green
results.brief_description: Designed for children of pre-school age; the story is set in a village deep in the heart of Never-Never Land among such characters as Peter the Postman, Windy Miller, the miller, and Captain Smart who runs a military academy.

results.title: Calling all motorcyclists
results.creator_credit: Dennis Shand, Maxwell Munden, Central Office of Information and Film Workshop
results.brief_description: This film is designed to impress upon all motorcyclists the constant need for care on the roads. It shows that even riders in motorcycle trials, whose performances delight and amaze their fans, do not take chances when they are on the roads, and are in fact more careful than some of the less experienced motorcyclists. Points mentioned include: hand signals, normal care and technique of safe riding; checking petrol, oil, equipment, tyres, wheel ruts, rear brake and steering; braking on a slippery surface; safe riding at night.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis Shand, Maxwell Munden, Central Office of Information and Film Workshop

results.title: Call of the khedda
results.brief_description: Shows the “khedda” method of capturing a herd of elephants in the Kakanote Forest. A large enclosure is built, the elephants surrounded and gradually driven into the khedda. They are roped and patiently tamed and trained until they become docile and friendly workers for the Indian people.

results.title: The Call of Lourdes
results.brief_description: This film shows people from all around the world visiting the ‘city of miracles’ in the foothills of the Pyrenees. Amongst them are 40,000 of the old, the ill and the crippled who seek relief, if not a cure. The film shows the many pilgrims and tourists, the ceremonies, prayers, the grotto, the mineral springs with special properties and the great churches. Lourdes is the ‘city shrine’ to Saint Bernadette.

results.title: Call it...rehabilitation
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The story of how an imaginary Canadian community might coordinate its resources, with federal and provincial government aid, to provide full rehabilitation services for its disabled citizens. The film follows a local doctor’s dream of community organization in which existing agencies are brought together into a cooperative plan whereby persons disabled by accident or disease may be restored to useful, productive places in their community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ernest Reid, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Call from Malaysia
results.creator_credit: Gilbert Lauzun and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: We follow the efforts of a young Sarawak villager as he learns to participate in broadcasting, telephony, aviation and other modern occupations required in Malaysia (1967). Six million people living on countless islands and one large peninsula are now united in the Federation of Malaysia and the agencies of the United Nations are at work helping them build a modern and effective country.

results.title: Call for order
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Designed to encourage two essentials to an efficient office— tidiness and cleanliness. An office which in the first place is badly designed, and then is littered with superfluous or redundant furniture, articles of clothing, over-flowing waste-paper baskets, stacks of files piled high on desks and tea cups and tea-making equipment, cannot possibly function efficiently, quite apart from being unpleasant to work in. The film offers suggestions aimed at keeping offices clean and tidy, thereby increasing efficiency and saving time, trouble and temper.
